properties.areaDesc: Acadia; Jefferson Davis; Evangeline; St. Landry; Avoyelles
properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued January 3 at 4:03AM CST until January 3 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Lake Charles LA
properties.description:
...FLASH FLOOD WATCH EXTENDED UNTIL 9 AM CST FRIDAY...

.Two to four inches of rainfall, with isolated amounts over six
inches, has fallen across portions of Central and Southwest
Louisiana. This has produced isolated areas of nusiance street
flooding. An additional one to two inches of rainfall will be
possible through mid morning. This additional rainfall may lead
to additional flash flooding.

The Flash Flood Watch is now in effect for

* Portions of central Louisiana and southwest Louisiana,
including the following areas, in central Louisiana,
Avoyelles, Evangeline, and St. Landry. In southwest Louisiana,
Acadia and Jefferson Davis.

* Until 9 AM CST this morning

* Two to four inches of rainfall have fallen across the area. An
additional one to two inches of rainfall will be possible this
evening through Friday morning. This additional rainfall may
produce flash flooding.

* Some roads may be flooded or possibly closed.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING
